Comment: This command info is generated from fig
Name: nx
Description: Fig completions for Nx by Nrwl

Arguments.Name: init
Arguments.Description: Adds nx.json file and installs nx if not installed already

Arguments.Name: generate
Arguments.Description: Runs a generator that creates and/or modifies files based on a generator from a collection

Arguments.Name: --defaults
Arguments.Description: When true, disables interactive input prompts for options with a default

Arguments.Name: --dryRun
Arguments.Description: When true, preview the changes without updating files

Arguments.Name: --force
Arguments.Description: When true, forces overwriting of existing files

Arguments.Name: run
Arguments.Description: Runs an Architect target with an optional custom builder configuration defined in your project

Arguments.Name: --configuration
Arguments.Description: A named builder configuration, defined in the "configurations" section of the workspace configuration file. The builder uses the named configuration to run the given target

Arguments.Name: daemon
Arguments.Description: Prints information about the Nx Daemon process or starts a daemon process

Arguments.Name: --exclude
Arguments.Description: Exclude certain projects from being processed

Arguments.Name: --focus
Arguments.Description: Use to show the project graph for a particular project and every node that is either an ancestor or a descendant

Arguments.Name: --groupByFolder
Arguments.Description: Group projects by folder in the project graph

Arguments.Name: --host
Arguments.Description: Bind the project graph server to a specific ip address

Arguments.Name: --open
Arguments.Description: Open the project graph in the browser

Arguments.Name: --port
Arguments.Description: Bind the project graph server to a specific port

Arguments.Name: --view
Arguments.Description: Choose whether to view the projects or task graph

Arguments.Name: --watch
Arguments.Description: Watch for changes to project graph and update in-browser

Arguments.Name: run-many
Arguments.Description: Run target for multiple listed projects

Arguments.Name: --configuration
Arguments.Description: A named builder configuration, defined in the "configurations" section of the workspace configuration file. The builder uses the named configuration to run the given target

Arguments.Name: --exclude
Arguments.Description: Exclude certain projects from being processed

Arguments.Name: --graph
Arguments.Description: Show the task graph of the command

Arguments.Name: --nx-bail
Arguments.Description: Stop command execution after the first failed task

Arguments.Name: --nx-ignore-cycles
Arguments.Description: Ignore cycles in the task graph

Arguments.Name: --output-style
Arguments.Description: Defines how Nx emits outputs tasks logs

Arguments.Name: --parallel
Arguments.Description: Max number of parallel processes [default is 3]

Arguments.Name: --runner
Arguments.Description: This is the name of the tasks runner configured in nx.json

Arguments.Name: --skip-nx-cache
Arguments.Description: Rerun the tasks even when the results are available in the cache

Arguments.Name: --verbose
Arguments.Description: Prints additional information about the commands (e.g., stack traces)

Arguments.Name: --base
Arguments.Description: Base of the current branch (usually main)

Arguments.Name: --files

Arguments.Name: migrate
Arguments.Description: Creates a migrations file or runs migrations from the migrations file

Arguments.Name: --commitPrefix
Arguments.Description: Commit prefix to apply to the commit for each migration, when --create-commits is enabled

Arguments.Name: --createCommits
Arguments.Description: Automatically create a git commit after each migration runs

Arguments.Name: --excludeAppliedMigrations
Arguments.Description: Exclude migrations that should have been applied on previous updates. To be used with --from

Arguments.Name: --from
Arguments.Description: Use the provided versions for packages instead of the ones installed in node_modules (e.g., --from="@nrwl/react@12.0.0,@nrwl/js@12.0.0")

Arguments.Name: --ifExists
Arguments.Description: Run migrations only if the migrations file exists, if not continues successfully

Arguments.Name: --runMigrations
Arguments.Description: Execute migrations from a file (when the file isn't provided, execute migrations from migrations.json)

Arguments.Name: --to
Arguments.Description: Use the provided versions for packages instead of the ones calculated by the migrator (e.g., --to="@nrwl/react@12.0.0,@nrwl/js@12.0.0")

Arguments.Name: report
Arguments.Description: Reports useful version numbers to copy into the Nx issue template

Arguments.Name: workspace-generator
Arguments.Description: Runs a workspace generator from the tools/generators directory

Arguments.Name: reset
Arguments.Description: Clears all the cached Nx artifacts and metadata about the workspace and shuts down the Nx Daemon

Arguments.Name: repair
Arguments.Description: Repair any configuration that is no longer supported by Nx

Arguments.Name: --verbose
Arguments.Description: Prints additional information about the commands (e.g., stack traces)

Arguments.Name: exec
Arguments.Description: Executes any command as if it was a target on the project

Arguments.Name: --configuration
Arguments.Description: A named builder configuration, defined in the "configurations" section of the workspace configuration file. The builder uses the named configuration to run the given target

Arguments.Name: --exclude
Arguments.Description: Exclude certain projects from being processed

Arguments.Name: --nx-bail
Arguments.Description: Stop command execution after the first failed task

Arguments.Name: --nx-ignore-cycles
Arguments.Description: Ignore cycles in the task graph

Arguments.Name: --output-style
Arguments.Description: Defines how Nx emits outputs tasks logs

Arguments.Name: --parallel
Arguments.Description: Max number of parallel processes [default is 3]

Arguments.Name: --runner
Arguments.Description: This is the name of the tasks runner configured in nx.json

Arguments.Name: --skip-nx-cache
Arguments.Description: Rerun the tasks even when the results are available in the cache

Arguments.Name: --verbose
Arguments.Description: Prints additional information about the commands (e.g., stack traces)

Arguments.Name: watch
Arguments.Description: Watch for changes within projects, and execute commands

Arguments.Name: --includeDependentProjects
Arguments.Description: When watching selected projects, include dependent projects as well

Arguments.Name: --verbose
Arguments.Description: Prints additional information about the commands (e.g., stack traces)

Arguments.Name: show
Arguments.Description: Show information about the workspace (e.g., list of projects)

Arguments.Name: view-logs
Arguments.Description: Enables you to view and interact with the logs via the advanced analytic UI from Nx Cloud to help you debug your issue. To do this, Nx needs to connect your workspace to Nx Cloud and upload the most recent run details. Only the metrics are uploaded, not the artefacts
